What is the general principle here? Say we have a composition of linear transformations \R^n \xrightarrow{T_A} \R^m \xrightarrow{T_B} \R^p given by matrix multiplication by matrices A and B respectively. State and prove a precise theorem about the matrix of the composition. Be very careful about the order of multiplication!

answer.p: Theorem: If \R^n \xrightarrow{T_A} \R^m \xrightarrow{T_B} \R^p are linear transformations given by matrix multiplication by matrices A and B respectively, then the composition T_B \circ T_A has the matrix BA. Proof: For any x \in \R^n, we have T_B \circ T_A(x) = T_B(T_A(x)) = T_B(Ax) = BAx = (BA)x.
